text: Hi All, New to the community, I am a software quality engineer that also uses sandbox testing of modules, I have little  experience to this kind of platform testing and would like to better practise this and for my team to be confident enough on my testing. Which course would you recommend for me to do?

Hi all! :wave: I'm new to HubSpot and needing to export all of the blog posts from my current site to import them to a new non-HubSpot site. However the regular export tool doesn't process the content of my blog posts. I'm able to export everything else but the content itself. That happened because the module is custom, so the data is unstructured and according to the support team - HubSpot's system doesn't have knowledge of what it considers a post_body in that module. The only solution is to use the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/cms/blog-post|Get all blog posts endpoint> and parse through all of the widgets (i.e. modules) in the response to pull the info from the custom Blog Post module. There are a ton of widgets and other parts of content in the JSON I get from that endpoint and I see no pattern at all to work with and unify.
Does anyone have any experience or ideas on how to approach that?

Thanks a lot in advance!

:orange_heart:*Please take a moment to review our Code of Conduct*:orange_heart:

We want the HubSpot Developer community to be inclusive and welcoming. By following our Code of Conduct, you can help ensure that's the case.

TL;DR:
• Be respectful
• Be inclusive (try not to say, "Hey guys, hey boys, hey [any specific group]")
• No self promotion, except for <#C0121KGC6RM|showcase> and <#CBNDYJJAZ|jobs> 
• No unsolicited DMs
Read the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/slack/code-of-conduct|whole thing here> - and thanks for being a part of the HubSpot Developer Community!

HubSpot creates an XML sitemap and let's users modify the content, but has anyone created a solution for using the XML sitemap to create an HTML sitemap?
